column1: Berries, peaches, apricots, plums, raisins, rhubarb, and prunes are just some of the fruits that may help.
Some high-fiber vegetables are asparagus, broccoli, corn, squash, and potatoes (with the skin still on).
Legumes (navy beans, kidney beans, chickpeas, soybeans, and lentils), peanuts, walnuts, and almonds will also add fiber to your diet.
You can also sprinkle 1 or 2 teaspoons of bran flakes, ground flax seeds, wheat bran, or psyllium on foods such as yogurt, cereal, and soup.
Your doctor may prescribe a laxative to relieve your constipation.
Women who are pregnant or breastfeeding and children under age 6 should NOT take laxatives without the advice of a health care provider.
